did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Eastern Wine and Grape Miscellany, 1850-20--.
did.physdesc: Memorabilia, Newspapers, Photographs, Printed Materials, Publications
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Wine and grape industry ephemera, including brochures, newspaper clippings, and other printed material

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Descriptive materials regarding wineries, vineyards, and associated businesses and organizations in the Eastern wine and grape industries. It's geographic scope will include all of the U.S. states east of the Rocky mountains. Currently the majority of the material covers New York State, particularly the Finger Lakes region. Types of materials include but are not limited to: news clippings, magazine articles, brochures, wine trail maps, tasting sheets, price lists and product catalogs.

descgrp.head: INFORMATION FOR USERS
descgrp.p: Guide lists folders in order as they appear in the boxes.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Eastern Wine and Grape Miscellany, #6695. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

scopecontent.p: Items are arranged in specific regions if possible. Documents containing information regarding a broader area over several regions may still contain region and even winery specific information. Undated folders will contain items with bulk dates from 1980s to 2000s. New York State winery items divided by region using in part the Uncork NY website www.newyorkwines.org for winery location information.

odd.head: NOTES
odd.p: Forms part of the Eastern Wine and Grape Archive. (EWGA)

The Taylor Wine Company, Inc. Annual Reports, bound together

scopecontent.p: Seaton C. Mendall former owner.

did.unittitle: Conversation with Jimmy Frisk & Mike Brace of Taylor Wine Company

scopecontent.p: Audio cassette originally recorded by Walter S. Taylor of Bully Hill. Frisk and Brace were employees of the Taylor Wine Company. Includes discussion of Greyton H. Taylor, Fred Taylor, Clarence Taylor, what Frisk and Brace were paid, ancedotes, and a party at which there will be the naming of a goat, perhaps the Bully Hill goat.

did.unittitle: Files, brochures, and correspondence relating to the origins of Cornell's Eastern Wine and Grape Archive, early collecting, and wine history references.

scopecontent.p: Includes info on the Philip Wagner collection, American Society for Enology and Viticulture involvement, lists of sources / books of wine history useful for the collection. Correspondence include Bruce Reisch, Justin Morris, and others. This info is available as digital files on CD-975 in folder. Also included is a copy of the paper "Wine Making In Canada and the Eastern United States" by Jacklin, Sharron, and Fordon, See also call number SB387.2 I575 2007 for other material relating to the conference where this paper was presented..

Series II. Oversized Ephemera
Posters: Finger Lakes Fall Festival October 1979; Wickham Vineyards (Hector, NY); Dr Konstantin Frank's vineyards

"Uncork New York" Wine Advertising posters from the New York Wine and Grape Foundation. Includes maps of the principal New York State Wine Districts, a poster listing New York State Gold Wines and Vineyards, and treatments of the sherry "Uncork New York" logo and its application to letterheads by Ketchum Public Relations, 1987
Advertising proofs for New York wines

Wine catalog for Sherry Wine & Spirits Co. Inc. Includes prices and descriptions of wine and liquor. Also includes listings for some vintages for sale dating back to 1818. Illustrated with drawings by Pablo Picasso with article about him by Alfred Frankfurter.

Large photo of the George Remaily Seedless grape; Posters of Delaware, Niagare, Cataruba and isabella grapes. Large pictures of the Graaf Reinet Museum and its exhibit of the "Largest Living Grape Vine in the World"
Star Gazette articles on the New York wine industry
4 Calendars: California Wineries
Series III. Videos
Savor the flavor, romancing America's grape. Lake Erie Concord grape belt, produced by the Concord Grape Belt Heritage Association.
